metadata.synopsis: Player comes upon a familiar face in the cursed land: Arabella, the girl they rescued from the snake in act 1. She has developed powers and is rooting shadow-creatures. She promises you to teach you this entangling power if you save her parents, who are lost.
metadata.how_to_trigger:
ReCon (commands must be done in this order):
- SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_ShadowDruid_State_SnakeCourtStarted- 
loadlevel SCL_Main_A
- addTag ACT2_SHADOW_CURSE_IMMUNE:b47643e0-583c-4808-b108-f6d3b605b0a9  (so we don't die of shadowcurse)
- goto -150; 31; 18

Then talk to Arabella

75.speaker: Arabella
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Before Arabella can finish, there is an eeries noise coming from behind her. Arabella turns to look as two Shadows emerge from the ground menacingly.NodeContext: About to continue from 'Hey, I know you! You're - ' with a proper introduction, but is interrupted by shadow creature spawning from ground.

152.context: CinematicNodeContext: The creatures groan menacingly and prepare to lunge

100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arbaella starts moving her hands to cast a spell, in the manner of Jaheira casting entangling vines.

120.speaker: Arabella
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arbaella starts moving her hands to cast a spell, in the manner of Jaheira casting entangling vines.

67.text: Impressive. Last I saw this child, she was cowed to Kagha's snake.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella casts her spell. Before the creatures can attack, vines rise from the ground and wrap around them, entangling them to her right

158.text: Impressive. Last I saw this child, she was cowed to Kagha's snake.

9.speaker: Arabella
9.text: Impressive. Last I saw this child, she was cowed to Kagha's snake.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Impressive. Last I saw this child, she was cowed to Kagha's snake.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: Isn't that Arabella? The little girl Kagha nearly killed?

137.speaker: Arabella
137.text: Sorry. Knocks the wind right out of me.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella turns away from the trapped creature, exhausted.

126.text: Sorry. Knocks the wind right out of me.
126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella turns away from the trapped creature, exhausted.

72.text: Sorry. Knocks the wind right out of me.
72.context: NodeContext: Said with a deep sigh

128.speaker: Arabella
128.text: Sorry. Knocks the wind right out of me.
128.context: NodeContext: Said with a deep sigh

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I'd be more impressed if you'd actually killed it.
12.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

143.speaker: Arabella
143.text: I don't know how. I'd kill 'em all if I could. I - I just want my mum and pops.

112.speaker: Arabella
112.text: We followed Zevlor out here. Then he - he -

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Arabella? You should be with your parents.
17.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

65.speaker: Arabella
65.text: That's who I'm looking for. Mum and pops, I mean. When Zevlor - when he -
65.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

57.speaker: Arabella
57.text: Well. There was an ambush. Mum yelled 'run!' So we ran.
57.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

59.speaker: Arabella
59.text: I could hear 'em running behind me. 'Til I couldn't.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

54.speaker: Arabella
54.text: Still can't find 'em - but I bet you can. You'll help me, I just know it!
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: *You notice the girl shivering in fear and anger. She is not yet ready to hear the truth of her parents' fate.*
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

94.text: *You notice the girl shivering in fear and anger. She is not yet ready to hear the truth of her parents' fate.*
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *You notice the girl shivering in fear and anger. She is not yet ready to hear the truth of her parents' fate.*
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I'll find your parents - you can count on me.
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'll think about it. My hands are full with these cultists.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

139.speaker: Arabella
139.text: Fine. Whatever. I don't need you - I'll find them myself!
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: You're going to get yourself killed. I'll find them, all right?
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

136.speaker: Arabella
136.text: Thanks so much. I knew you'd help me again!
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

53.speaker: Arabella
53.text: The vines won't last forever. I don't - I don't s'pose I can stay with you?
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: She eyes the rooted shadow-creatures, and the camera turns to show them at the beginning of the line.NodeContext: Slightly unsure of herself.

149.speaker: Arabella
149.text: Just 'til you find mum and pops. I won't be any trouble, I swear it!

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I was just poking at the rancid dog-meat of your parents' corpses.
14.context: NodeContext: Starts to splutter with tears.

2.speaker: Arabella
2.text: You're trying to scare me... to see if I'm tough enough to make it out there.
2.context: NodeContext: Starts to splutter with tears.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Their bodies fester, pumped full enough of quack serums, swelling organs ready to burst.
127.context: NodeContext: Starts to splutter with tears.

114.speaker: Arabella
114.context: NodeContext: Starts to splutter with tears.

146.speaker: Arabella
146.context: NodeContext: Starts to splutter with tears.

95.speaker: Arabella
95.text: You're worse than all the nasties in this blighted place.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella runs away into the darkness in the cinematic after this line to be found dead later.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'm telling the truth: you don't want to find them.

157.speaker: Arabella
157.text: Then what... what is even left for me to do?

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Live, grow up, and make your path anew by my side.

56.speaker: Arabella
56.text: You're right. If I become strong, they will look on me with pride from beyond.

62.speaker: Arabella
62.text: You're right. If I become strong, they will look on me with pride from beyond.

166.text: I don't want to forget about them... I can't.

109.speaker: Arabella
109.text: I don't want to forget about them... I can't.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: It doesn't matter what you do - you'll end up dead like them, out here.

111.speaker: Arabella
111.text: I'll prove it. Let me help in the camp, til you bring mom and pops back to me.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Suppress your delight in her parents' death. Offer her shelter.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Muster some kindness for once. Offer her shelter.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Of course. You can stay in my camp.

71.speaker: Arabella
71.text: So you send mum and pops there. I'll be waiting, hero-person!

176.speaker: Player
176.text: There's an inn called Last Light. Alfira's there - you'll be safe.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: There's an inn called Last Light. You'll be safe there.

103.speaker: Arabella
103.text: I mean, I'm sure you think that. But you ain't seen what I seen.

164.speaker: Arabella
164.text: I don't trust no one 'sides myself, no more - save three. Mum, pops, and you.

108.speaker: Arabella
108.text: Take me in. I won't make a peep - cross my heart, hope to die.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Forget it. No kids in my camp.

160.speaker: Arabella
160.text: Whatever - who needs your lousy camp? I got powers. All I need is me.
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arbaella runs off in gameplay afterwards.NodeContext: Was going to protest, but changes her mind and tries to sound confident as she prepares to face almost certain death

11.speaker: Arabella
11.text: Plucked from Kagha's talons, only to run to the shadows. Fickle, the both of you.

175.speaker: Lae'zel
175.text: Plucked from Kagha's talons, only to run to the shadows. Fickle, the both of you.

102.speaker: Shadowheart
102.text: I'm not sure I like her chances out here, even if she does have powers.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: I do like her spirit. I don't like her chances, but her spirit? Excellent.

46.speaker: Wyll
46.text: Sending a child out there to die? Damned spiteful. Figured you better than that.

171.speaker: Wyll
171.text: Sending a child out there to die? Damned spiteful - even for you.

85.speaker: Gale
85.text: That was rather inhospitable. She could well die out there, we should go after her.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Forget the search. Your parents are dead.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is frightened and angry. Darkness starts to surround her.NodeContext: Found out her parents are dead. Distraught - her sorcerous powers begin to manifest, intensifying her emotional state.

1.speaker: Arabella
1.text: You lie! They're out there. And if you won't find 'em, I will!
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is frightened and angry. Darkness starts to surround her.NodeContext: Found out her parents are dead. Distraught - her sorcerous powers begin to manifest, intensifying her emotional state.

92.text: Your parents are with you always, in memory. Join my camp, let me help you.
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her emotional intensity lessens, and the darkness around her fades as she calms downNodeContext: Calming down, your former intensity lost as you come to terms with your grief

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Your parents are with you always, in memory. Join my camp, let me help you.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her emotional intensity lessens, and the darkness around her fades as she calms downNodeContext: Calming down, your former intensity lost as you come to terms with your grief

44.speaker: Arabella
44.text: You're right. If I do something stupid and end up dead, there'll be nobody to remember them.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her emotional intensity lessens, and the darkness around her fades as she calms downNodeContext: Calming down, your former intensity lost as you come to terms with your grief

125.speaker: Player
125.text: They're gone, Arabella - but you have a new family now. Come to my camp.
125.context: InternalNodeContext: I'm terribly sorry - it does seem you'll have to come up with a line powerful enough to feasible calm down a child in a denial part of grief. - EkatA

15.speaker: Arabella
15.text: New... family? But I don't want...
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella calms down a bit but is still sad. The darkness surrounding her fades.

90.speaker: Arabella
90.text: New... family? But I don't want...
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella calms down a bit but is still sad. The darkness surrounding her fades.

141.text: All right. I'll go to the camp, like you said. Just...
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the dialogue ends, she runs off in gameplay.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion successes, don't read too deep into that - EkatA

66.speaker: Arabella
66.text: All right. I'll go to the camp, like you said. Just...
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the dialogue ends, she runs off in gameplay.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion successes, don't read too deep into that - EkatA

115.speaker: Arabella
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the dialogue ends, she runs off in gameplay.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion successes, don't read too deep into that - EkatA

104.text: I have a family. And if you won't find them, I will!
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella runs away into the darkness in the cinematic after this line to be found dead later.

78.speaker: Arabella
78.text: I have a family. And if you won't find them, I will!
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella runs away into the darkness in the cinematic after this line to be found dead later.

130.speaker: Arabella
130.text: Capricious child. She almost got herself killed once. Seems she's intent on finishing the job.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: Capricious child. She almost got herself killed once. Seems she's intent on finishing the job.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: She's going to get herself killed out here, powers or not.

113.speaker: Karlach
113.text: Fierce kid. Doubt she'll survive the shadows, but I hope she'll surprise us.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Pity, I kind of liked her. Oh well.

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: Damn it - new powers or not, the kid's going to get herself killed.

172.speaker: Gale
172.text: Stubborn little tyke! Even if she can swing a spell or two, she's going to get herself killed out here.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: People die, and that's that. You can stay in my camp, if you quit your blubbering.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella pulls herself together, trying to look tough, and the darkness around her dissipates.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion success, don't read too deep into that - EkatANodeContext: Take a big breath before line, trying to keep from crying.

86.speaker: Arabella
86.text: Yeah. All right. If that's what I gotta do.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella pulls herself together, trying to look tough, and the darkness around her dissipates.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion success, don't read too deep into that - EkatANodeContext: Take a big breath before line, trying to keep from crying.

48.speaker: Arabella
48.text: Yeah. All right. If that's what I gotta do.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella pulls herself together, trying to look tough, and the darkness around her dissipates.InternalNodeContext: There is an identical node for other persuasion - this is a matter of me being lazy and using same stub text for both persuasion success, don't read too deep into that - EkatANodeContext: Take a big breath before line, trying to keep from crying.

81.speaker: Arabella
81.text: Camp, huh? Guess I'll see you when I see you.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the dialogue ends, Arabella runs off in gameplay.

116.text: To the hells with your camp, and to the hells with you.
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is still angry. She runs off in gameplay.

83.speaker: Arabella
83.text: To the hells with your camp, and to the hells with you.
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is still angry. She runs off in gameplay.

19.speaker: Player
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is still angry, and no longer cares about the danger around here. She runs off in gameplay.

144.speaker: Narrator
144.text: Pops can't be dead. He said he'd never leave me, no matter what.

16.speaker: Arabella
16.text: Pops can't be dead. He said he'd never leave me, no matter what.

43.text: *The girl's mind is closed to you.*

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *The girl's mind is closed to you.*

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Do what you want. I'm not stopping you.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is still angry, and no longer cares about the danger around here. She runs off in gameplay.

60.speaker: Arabella
60.text: Good. To the hells with you.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is still angry, and no longer cares about the danger around here. She runs off in gameplay.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Their corpses, maybe. Your parents are dead.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I've rarely seen corpses as violated as theirs are - it was quite the sight.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: And then you'll teach me those powers of yours?

169.speaker: Arabella
169.text: Sure. The vine trick, at least. Maybe some others.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: And how much gold will you give me in return?

91.speaker: Arabella
91.text: I got powers. But pulling coins from the sky ain't one.

7.speaker: Arabella
7.text: Tell you what - I'll teach you the vine trick. Maybe some others.

154.speaker: Arabella
154.text: But not 'til you get my mum and pops back.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Forget it, kid. You can take care of yourself, from the looks of it.

151.speaker: Arabella
151.text: I mean, damn right I can! I don't need you. I'll do it myself. Hmph!
151.context: NodeContext: ... finding confidence again, and defiant as she prepares to leave and enter the dangerous shadows once more

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Your parents are dead, sorry to say.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Your parents are test-fodder stuffed full of needles, little orphan.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: That's a powerful spell. Where did you learn to do that?

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You've learnt magic like my own, child. Who taught you druidcraft?

119.speaker: Arabella
119.text: No one - I learnt it all on my own! Well... I had a little help.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: You need to take care with wild magic. You could end up hurting yourself.

70.speaker: Arabella
70.text: I don't think so. I'm good. Well, kinda good.

147.speaker: Arabella
147.text: That druid idol I took? It changed me. I can do all sorts of stuff now, not just the vines.

58.speaker: Arabella
58.text: I think real hard and say some loud words and then it happens. Mostly.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Nature's magic only grows stronger with age, little one. Learn to control it now, while you still can.

153.speaker: Arabella
153.text: If I get strong enough, I won't have to run next time... Hmm.

138.speaker: Arabella
138.text: Okay. I promise to be really good with practising - but only if you look for my mum and pops. Deal?

30.speaker: Player
30.text: What are you doing out here? It's not safe.
30.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

93.speaker: Arabella
93.text: I was looking. For mum and pops. When Zevlor - when he -
93.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: How about you teach me those powers of yours?
77.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

49.speaker: Arabella
49.text: Mm. Maybe. But you gotta help me first.
49.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

68.speaker: Arabella
68.text: Me and mum and pops, we followed Zevlor out here. Then he - he -
68.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: That's a powerful spell. Where did you learn to do that?
163.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You've learnt magic like my own, child. Who taught you druidcraft?
41.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Nature's magic only grows stronger with age, little one. Learn to control it now, while you still can.
142.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: And no wonder. You could hurt yourself with magic that wild.
63.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Normally tales of stolen artefacts are tragedies - I'm glad you've bucked that trend.
118.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

129.speaker: Arabella
129.text: Tragedies? Them's the sad ones, right? I hope not.
129.context: NodeContext: Has a hard time telling player what happened... but then pulls herself together.

24.speaker: Arabella
24.text: 'Specially since mum and pops - After Zevlor - When he -

38.speaker: Karlach
38.text: Hey! That's Arabella. Kid from the druid's grove. That snake woman nearly did her in. Looks like she's learned a thing or two.

174.speaker: Astarion
174.text: It's you - our little idol thief from the druids' grove!

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: Is that... the kid Kagha went after? Seems she's learned a new trick.

156.speaker: Gale
156.text: Wait, that's Arabella, is it not? Looks like she's got some new Weave up her sleeve.

155.speaker: Narrator
155.text: *You remember this girl - Arabella, from the druids' grove, the thief Kagha tried to punish.*

88.speaker: Arabella
88.text: I don't see any - wait. Here they come!
88.context: NodeContext: About to say she doesn't see any shadow creatures.
